title: NFL Draft 2021: Eagles’ Jalen Hurts gives advice to incoming rookie class
body: Philadelphia Eagles QB Jalen Hurts was selected in the second round of the 2020 NFL Draft. learned a lot about the NFL and Philadelphia as a rookie.Last year’s second-round pick went from the  on the ’ roster in training camp to the starter by Week 14. Along with his lessons on the field, Hurts learned a lot about how to handle his money as a professional athlete. , Hurts said he spent roughly $165K of his initial earnings. That total included offseason training, agent fees, charity work and paying off the car that he bought in college.Hurts hired a financial advisor who offered him sage advice. With that wisdom in mind, he offered the incoming 2021 rookie class some financial input.“Having this amount of money for the first time ever in your life, be wise with your decisions and your choices,” Hurts said to GQ. “I know you have things that you’ve always dreamed of having, maybe, and that’s perfect, go get, you’ve earned it, but also be smart, mindful and prepared (because) it goes by quick.”Hurts wasn’t completely frugal with his spending as a rookie. He told GQ that he spent roughly $30K on a new wardrobe and jewelry. He had never had a legitimate gold chain before, and now he has two that he proudly displayed during the interview.Hurts is the presumed starting QB for the Eagles this offseason. With just Hurts and  on the roster, the second-year QB could be passing out more advice to a fellow signal-caller this summer. The Eagles have 11 picks in the upcoming draft, and one selection could be used on a quarterback.
